author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Fast Track Mahila Court, Tiruvannamalai on Thursday sentenced a man to seven years imprisonment for abetting his wife to commit suicide in 2005.

P. U. Chemmal, Judge, Fast Track Mahila Court, Tiruvannamalai, sentenced Lourdu Raj to two years imprisonment and Rs. 1,000 penalty for offences under Section 498A (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty) and seven years imprisonment and Rs. 2,000 fine under Section 306 (Abetment of suicide) of Indian Penal Code, R. Shanthakumari, special public prosecutor said..

On July 8, 2005, his wife, Christi, then aged 21 years, committed suicide by hanging in her house. The couple was married three months ago. They were residing in C. Nammiyandal, Chengam taluk.

Lourdu Raj, then aged 29 years, was working in a cinema theatre canteen in Andhra Pradesh. He had allegedly harassed her and demanded dowry. Unable to bear the torture, Christi had committed suicide, she said.
title: Man sentenced to seven years for abetting wife's suicide
